Html:
How do I filter tier sets?

I'm trying to only show gear I can get with heroics and Triumph/Frost emblems. I deselected T10 raids, but I'm still seeing T10 gear set pieces. I don't see anything that looks like a likely filter. Am I missing something?
Make sure World Drop and BOE items are deselected too. Its possible that some high items drop that are BoE and not in the raid sections themselves.
I'm not talking about drops. I'm talking about T10 set gear that you get by winning a mark and turning it in for set gear, up to and including ilvl 277 heroic Sanctified gear.
There is indeed, they're listed under currency/tokens, I believe.
I looked under currency/tokens and didn't see them.
Under 'Special Currency ...' there are 2 things you have to uncheck, Armor Tokens and under both Frost and Triumph Emblems, their Armor Tokens boxes.
Oh, now I see it! I hadn't noticed the Armor Tokens section before. Thanks for pointing it out
For EVERYONE's future reference, please don't reply by email. Come back to the website to post your reply.

Sorry. Didn't realize it was doing that. I've edited my posts to take out the spammy stuff.

Normally I would go to the discussion to reply, to make sure nothing was added that I missed. It's too bad the email reply does that though. In any case, I won't be using it in the future.

Well, I'm still having the same problem. In fact, it's weirder than I realized!

When I filter all Armor Tokens, Turalyon's Legplates of Triumph (which are purchased with Emblems of Triumph) *are* filtered, but Sanctified Lightswordn Legplates (264 and 277) are still listed!
Actually, that one should be under "Armor Tokens", right?  (251's are NOT showing and 264/277 ARE showing.)
There are 3 'Armor Tokens' checkboxes, like I said. 1 main one and 1 each under Triumph and Frost

Okay, I see that now, but that was *very* confusing. I'm sure I'm not the first nor the last to have that same problem.

Incidentally, what kinds of things are is covered by the "Other" category, both under Triumph and Frost Emblems, and as a main category?
Other is automatically added to every group, it's just there to catch anything that doesn't get covered by something more specific. Most of the time, it does nothing.
Also, "Hi, I'm a dummie, and don't actually look at the program when making stupid comments to Jothay".  (That was a self-jab, not one aimed at you, Pal.)
